projects.name: Life Prompt
projects.description: I wanted to create something that allowed me to start keeping a diary with the smallest amount of friction possible. So I hacked together an interface-free app that uses Twilio and Google's Speech Recognition API to call the user daily and ask for a recap of their day. It then transcribes this audio into text for easy reference and analysis.

projects.name: Tandem
projects.description: For extremely busy people that want to schedule in-person group meetings, we provide a service that considers everyoneâ€™s schedules and determines the best time to meet before the first email is sent.

projects.name: Shift Scheduler
projects.description: This was a class project that required my group to create an application using object oriented design practices. We chose to build a scheduling application. In this project I identified project requirements, created user tasks, and class diagrams. I also worked on application development using Android Studio.

projects.name: Skratch Labs blog
projects.description: Created a custom squarespace template to be used by Skratch Labs for their new blogging platform.

projects.name: Musical tiles
projects.description: Created a table that generates music based on the positioning of tiles placed on it. Reactivision fiducial codes were used to identify where tiles had been placed. This information was then a Max MSP step sequencer to generate harmonies. This project has been featured twice on Instructables.com.

projects.name: Whitebark pine
projects.description: Worked with a National Park scientist using GIS and micro-meteorological weather data to identify the most suitable habitat for reestablishing white pine stands.

projects.name: Camera Goat site
projects.description: Redesigned the web presence of the Camera Goat mobile camera dolly.

projects.name: HCD Visualisation
projects.description: I've taken an amazing class called Human Centered Computing and Professional Development three times now (by choice!). Everyone who takes the class fills out a form every week about what they've been doing. I wanted a way to give back to the class, so I  created a Python script that scrapes the last 5 years of entries from the class website. Then, I used D3.js to create visualisations based on the data I obtained.

projects.name: Node Tradedesk module
projects.description: A node.js module for interacting with The Trade Desk's API

projects.name: Airworx Cinema
projects.description: Co-founder of Airworx Cinema, an aerial cinematography company that produces promotional content and live broadcasts

projects.name: LT11.tv
projects.description: A website that aggregates Louder Than 11 live broadcasts into one easily navigable resource including live scoring of events.

projects.name: This Site
projects.description: This site has been through a lot of iterations (with more to come!). I wanted a way to share all of the projects I've worked on with the world. I've built out the site around 5 times iterating towards a design and implementation that I like. Everything on the site -- from the modals, to the header -- was coded from the ground up by me. In the future I'll be adding a dedicated page for my photography and a blog.

projects.name: Deepwater GIS
projects.description: Performed modeling of the impact of the Deep Water Horizon oil spill on coastal ecosystem services. This work was done through a research experience for undergraduates (REU) at the University of Arkansas

projects.name: DevCoded
projects.description: A marketplace for developers of video game plugins to be matched with clients desiring custom enhancements. This is a sideproject that is still under development

projects.name: CasteGaming
projects.description: Co-founder of CasteGaming, the first online hosting platform and community for fans of multiplayer voxel-based games

projects.name: DoItLive
projects.description: A browser app intended to be run locally to interface with Dropbox API in an effort to allow users to easily store files on the Dropbox servers without having local copies.

projects.name: Dairy Calculator
projects.description: The dairy allocation calculator is a web app that will be used by dairy farmers to calculate their product level life cycle allocation (A metric for environmental impact). The work was completed for the University of Arkansas

projects.name: Dijkstra
projects.description: A C++ implementation of dijkstra's single source shortest pathfinding algorithm.

projects.name: 9001 Memes
projects.description: This was an open source web app intended to allow users to create memes (web comics). We approached the project with the goal of using no backend servers, but quickly ran into roadblacks with implementing community voting

projects.name: Boids
projects.description: An implementation of the Boids artificial life program. The program was made to be used as an interactive design element in a web page.
